ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Psychogenic Tinnitus and Dizziness
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient presents with a 'chaos narrative', severe anxiety, and symptoms exacerbated by a recent traumatic event; dizziness is vague and testing is inconclusive due to anxiety.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: High-Frequency Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry confirms mild-to-moderate high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss bilaterally.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hyperacusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial severe reduction in loudness discomfort levels (LDLs) which normalized following desensitization exercises.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess retrocochlear pathway, though could not be completed due to patient anxiety.
To determine degree and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception and recognition abilities.
To evaluate hearing sensitivity in extended high frequencies (9-20 kHz).
To quantify sound tolerance and evaluate for hyperacusis.
To assess tinnitus characteristics, though limited by patient intolerance.
To quantify the functional and emotional impact of dizziness.
To assess vestibular function, though aborted due to nausea.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial evaluation identified mild-to-moderate high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss. Testing was complicated by significant patient anxiety and aural discomfort, preventing completion of right ear tympanometry and all acoustic reflexes.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Left ear Type A; Right ear CNT due to discomfort.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Could not be obtained due to patient concern regarding sound levels.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Mild-to-moderate high-frequency SNHL bilaterally; low frequencies normal to mild.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 30 dB HL AU; WRS 88% (Right) and 80% (Left) at 55 dB HL.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Tinnitus evaluation revealed severe sound intolerance (hyperacusis) and extended high-frequency hearing loss. The patient was visibly shaken due to a recent traumatic event, which exacerbated her symptoms and prevented completion of tinnitus questionnaires.

tests.name: High-frequency audiometry
tests.result_summary: Moderate to moderately-severe hearing loss bilaterally from 9,000 to 20,000 Hz.

tests.name: Loudness Discomfort Levels (LDL)
tests.result_summary: Severely reduced tolerance; 65-75 dB HL for tones, 70 dB HL for speech.

tests.name: Tinnitus Evaluation
tests.result_summary: Could not be completed due to intolerance of procedures; questionnaires declined.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Vestibular assessment was largely inconclusive as the patient became nauseous and anxious, aborting the vHIT. Self-report indicated severe handicap from dizziness. Pre-fitting evaluation showed normalization of loudness tolerance levels following desensitization exercises, allowing for successful hearing aid fitting.

tests.name: vHIT
tests.result_summary: Aborted because patient became quickly nauseous.

tests.name: Loudness Discomfort Levels (LDL)
tests.result_summary: Normalized to 90-110 dB HL (tones) and 100-105 dB HL (speech).

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Confirmed mild sloping to moderate high-frequency SNHL.

proposed_items: Smartphone app for hearing aid control
Referral to Disability Resource Services (DRS) for workplace accommodations
Referral to Primary Care Physician for global health concerns
Pharmacist review of medications and supplements
counseling_actions: Discuss the 'chaos narrative' and help patient focus on concrete management steps
Explain the relationship between anxiety/stress and exacerbation of tinnitus/dizziness
Clarify correct method for desensitization (start soft, not loud)
Instruction on hearing aid features and smartphone app

red_flags_present: Inability to complete vestibular testing due to severe symptoms

escalation.rationale_short: To rule out neurologic causes for diplopia/dizziness and address severe anxiety and psychogenic factors complicating the presentation.

follow_up_plan.objective: Return for vestibular assessment and hearing aid fitting after desensitization period.

expected_outcome: Loudness Discomfort Levels (LDL): Repeated measures normalized to 90-110 dB HL (tones) and 100-105 dB HL (speech) following desensitization.
Patient successfully fitted with binaural receiver-in-the-canal (RIC) hearing aids.
Reported hearing aid issues resolved following re-instruction on smartphone app usage.
